author: Felecia Townsend

review: I debated between the stick and Roku 3 for a few hours before I decided to save the $40 and reduce clutter on my TV stand. This was a mistake. While it does hide nicely, depending on where your HDMI ports are this could be a problem for remote interaction and WIFI connection. The delay between turning on the TV and the Roku being ready to go is between 45 and 60 seconds. I borrowed a friends 3 and the start up time is exponentially faster.I love the Roku, but for anyone even remotely on the fence between the stick and the 3, go with the 3. Also, when you start to think "and I don't even really need the keyboard on the Roku 3 remote, I can just use the arrows on the basic remote that comes with the stick" you're wrong - you need the keyboard. It sucks having to arrow through long movie titles.

review: This worked for me the first two times I used it. Got it all set up and worked fine - twice. A week later I go to watch it again and I could not get past the bouncing ROKU screen. Did 3 hard resets. The first seemed to work and after I set everything up again it crashed and screen went black. 2nd and third time it didn't work at all. Maybe it's just mine that's faulty but I'm out $40. I have another ROKU that has worked fine for 2 years. I've wasted hours trying to troubleshoot this and nothing is working.
